author: quangtran
title: Haskell Book Vietnamese Translation
description: Cardano's Smart Contract is built on Haskell. But there is no book or document about Haskell for developers in Vietnam

f6_assessments.q0:
- Vietnam is a dynamic market with enthusiastic young people, eager to learn new things. Especially quickly absorbing new technologies in the field of information technology. The Axie Infinity project is one of the famous blockchain-based game projects in Vietnam in recent years.
- However, technical English is a big barrier for programmers in general and blockchain developers in particular in Vietnam. The majority of Vietnamese people use business English for transactions.
- The solution of translating a basic technical book on Haskell is a good idea to help Blockchain enthusiasts in Vietnam access a new programming language, helping Vietnamese youth develop a new industry. From there, there will be many more creative ideas contributing to Catalyst as well as the Cardano ecosystem.
***Suggestions/advice
- If the proponent can organize knowledge sharing sessions via Zoom on a fixed weekly basis for those who have downloaded the book, it will be much more effective.
- The proposal has not stated specific marketing solutions that the proposal will use to attract the community to download books as well as the specific ways the proposal will be shared with the community.
- If it is proposed to have more solutions to take care of the community of people who have read the book, it will be great. This helps the proposal to have a long-term commitment and credibility with the community. Motivate readers to download and learn.
- Proposers can share the public link to download this document to the community, it will help more people to access the Haskell programming language
f6_assessments.q1:
- The idea of the project is feasible and can be implemented easily. Because young Vietnamese people are very diligent in tinkering, eager to learn and quickly absorbing new technologies.
- In Vietnam, there are many spontaneous small groups doing research on Haskell language, even centers that teach Haskell courses. This document will contribute to the community as a source of additional information.
- A clear work allocation plan for each month
- There are numbers that can be measured as well as calculated
- The team has 3 main members with skills and experience suitable for the project
+ Mr. Curtis D'Alves has many years of experience with the Haskell language
+ Mr. Quang Daniel is a Vietnamese English teacher with good English and Vietnamese skills
+ Ms. Hannah is experienced in community building and knowledgeable about the Cardano ecosystem
***Suggestions/advice
- The translation time of 1 month is relatively short with a lot of work (650 pages of English technical language into Vietnamese) for 1 translator. If there is a translation team, the proponent should mention it in the team composition to increase the feasibility of the project.
- The project needs to have a detailed and specific Marketing plan for each stage.
- the project needs to reallocate translation time
f6_assessments.q2:
- The project has a Github link
- The proposal has given specific commitment figures for each month
- Provide criteria and target numbers for each criterion to evaluate the success of the project after 3 months of implementation.
***Suggestions/advice
- The proposed numbers are very specific and detailed, but there is still no specific measurement solution to avoid inaccurate information because these data can be easily faked. That makes the assessment of the success of the project inaccurate.
- Proposers can use google tools to measure and evaluate the index
f6_assessments.reply:
Thank you very much for taking the time to assess our proposal

Feasibility: "The translation time of 1 month is relatively short with a lot of work (650 pages of English technical language into Vietnamese) for 1 translator. If there is a translation team, the proponent should mention it in the team composition to increase the feasibility of the project." - We have a team member with 7 years of experience in teaching and translating in Vietnam. If you have ever been involved in translation work, you will know that on average 1 translator can translate 100 pages (300 words/page)/day (in 8 working hours). Therefore, 650 pages translated in 1 month ~22 pages/day is feasible.

Auditability: "there is still no specific measurement solution to avoid inaccurate information because these data can be easily faked. That makes the assessment of the success of the project inaccurate." - I agree with you that the number of downloads on google drive can be faked. But it's like youtube views, likes, comments. You can also fake those parameters. But it's not because we're skeptical that we can't measure the success of a proposal by those criteria because it's easy to fake. We still have to use the number of downloads, views, and likes to know if the document or video is successful or not. 
In addition, we also have other indicators such as: The number of developers participating in the Plutus Pioneer course can be measured by registration forms.
The number of proposals submitted on Catalyst can be checked by "Has someone referred you to become a proposer?"
